title: Strengthening the Multisectoral Approach for Dengue Prevention and Control
decision_details:
- Dengue has now become a major public health problem in Sri Lanka and by November 2021, 25910 dengue patients and 19 deaths had been reported. Since there is a tendency to further escalate Dengue during this monsoon rainy season, which has reached alarming proportions, an integrated national programme  has been scheduled to be implemented through the Ministries  with the participation of all parties concerned. Accordingly, the following proposals made by H.E. the President, were approved by the Cabinet.

    • to nominate an officer in each institution dedicated to continue dengue prevention and control activities. 

    • to review matters at the District Coordinating Committee and Divisional Coordination Committee meetings and take necessary action.

    • to vest the responsibility of provincial, district, divisional and grassroot level coordinating activities on prevention of dengue with the Provincial Governors.

    • to update the existing rules and regulations pertaining to the prevention of Dengue.

    • to assign the responsibility of  coordinating overall activities on the prevention of Dengue to the National Dengue Prevention Unit.
